channel.title: [JAVA] Rounding an entered number to the nearest integer
channel.description:
Ok so i have a JTextField and you can enter a time into it, so what i want to do is have something round that to the nearest whole number... So something like [code]int count = (int) (blahblahblah(entertime.getText()));[/code]
but i cant figure it out
can anyone help?

item.title: [JAVA] Rounding an entered number to the nearest integer
item.dc:creator: @The_Enforcer The Enforcer
item.description:
@The_Enforcer wrote:

veer:

Casting to an int is a narrowing conversion and works by truncating the value, which is equivalent to the ceiling for negative integers and the floor for positive ones. It should then be clear that it is not the same as rounding to the nearest integer value, so no you did not figure it out.

I have said something very similar before. I’m afraid you’re going to have to contact my lawyer if you want to post patented knowledge.

Read full topic
item.source: [JAVA] Rounding an entered number to the nearest integer

item.title: [JAVA] Rounding an entered number to the nearest integer
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

double input = Double.parseDouble(text_field.getText());
int rounded = (int) Math.round(input);

item.title: [JAVA] Rounding an entered number to the nearest integer
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

int rounded = (int) (x+0.5f);

Or

int rounded = Math.round(x);

Both ways work

item.title: [JAVA] Rounding an entered number to the nearest integer
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

An integer is and can only be a whole number. >.> I don’t understand why you need this but I think you can try

Math.round()
